results.title: The Price of fire
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Bruce Parsons
results.brief_description: Filmed under great difficulty and risk in Montreal’s worst fire zone, this film argues, in ways no audience can ignore, the case for inspection and prevention. It is a strong reminder of the price of carelessness and the need for vigilance, especially during winter months when fire hazards are at their height.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Bruce Parsons

results.title: The Price of a life
results.creator_credit: American Foundation Institute of Corrections, Vission Associates, Frank Loveland and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Docudrama which explores probation in the correctional systems in the United States. Traces the entire probation process through the case history of an offender on his way to becoming a habitual criminal. Considers means and methods by which probation can be strengthened and made more effective. A sequel to The Odds Against. Stars Martin Sheen in main role.

results.title: The Pressure principle
results.creator_credit: Searle Education Systems and Peter Glushanok
results.brief_description: Successful men discuss the stimulation, pressure, excitement and constant responsibility of their jobs, their ability to adapt to stress and its effect on lifestyle, family, leisure.

results.title: The Pressure of light
results.brief_description: Light pressure on a thin foil suspended in high vacuum sets the foil into oscillation. It leads up to this by a discussion of the Crookes radiometer and the effect - not light pressure - that causes it to rotate. The role of light pressure in the universe is also briefly discussed.
results.description: Light pressure on a thin foil suspended in high vacuum sets the foil into oscillation. It leads up to this by a discussion of the Crookes radiometer and the effect - not light pressure - that causes it to rotate. The role of light pressure in the universe is also briefly discussed.

results.title: The Presidency: search for a candidate
results.creator_credit: United Press International Television News, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Maurice Schonfeld
results.brief_description: Every four years the political parties of the United States engage in an internal power struggle in the process of nominating candidates for the presidency. The big effort at the party convention - and in the preconvention campaigns - is to find the man who can win. This film portrays the variety of means a contestant can successfully pursue to become his party’s candidate. Original footage of conventions is used to illustrate the selection process. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Present from Gondwanaland
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Mike Weatherley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Two hundred million years ago the giant continent Gondwanaland split and Australia drifted away. Its plants and animals evolved in isolation from the rest of the world. How does a tree used as a prison fit into the story and what are the secrets of the gum tree’s success? Narrated by David Bellamy.

results.title: The Preschooler's mind
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, Southern California Consortium and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Time to grow”.
Studies the surge in children’s development between ages two and a half and six which Piaget describes as a progression from prelogical to operational logical thinking.

results.title: The Preparation of food: Stone age to space age
results.brief_description: Discusses the increasing importance of food ad its preparation, particularly when men are confined for long periods of time in space stations similar to NASA’s Lunar Receiving Laboratories.
